articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Ambassador of Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Ambassador of Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Martin Tomco, outgoing ambassador of the Czech Republic to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese Official
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese Official
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Chen Zhenggao, governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government, on the occasion of the New Year.
					 The governor conveyed the gift to the DPRK consul general in Shenyang on Jan. 4.

articles.title: More Mass Rallies Held
articles.content:
More Mass Rallies Held 
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies took place in North Hwanghae Province, North Hamgyong Province, Kangwon Province, Ryanggang Province, Nampho City and Rason City on Jan. 6 to thoroughly implement the militant tasks laid down in the joint New Year editorial and respond to the letter sent by the employees of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex to all other working people across the country.
					 Present there were officials of the party, power and economic organs and working people's organizations, working people and youth and students in local areas.
					
					 After reports were delivered, participants of the rallies heard the above-said letter and speeches. 
					
					The reporters and speakers declared all the party members and other working people would give free rein to the spirit with which to devotedly defend General Secretary Kim Jong Il and carry through his instructions, bearing in mind the faith that they are sure to triumph as long as they are under his leadership.
					
					 They called for increasing the production of daily necessities on the basis of the locally available raw and other materials, holding high the torch of the revolution in the local industry kindled by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They underscored the need to attain the ambitious targets for the production of iron and steel without fail and boost the production of concentrated iron ore, while consolidating the successes made in the production of Juche iron.
					
					 They called for boosting the grain production by thoroughly implementing the Party's policy of making a revolution in agriculture in an effort to reliably protect the lifeline for the settlement of the problem of the people's living. 
					
					 They called for building a thriving socialist nation of Juche on this land.

articles.title: New Year's Concert Given for Foreign Diplomats
articles.content:
New Year's Concert Given for Foreign Diplomats
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here and foreign guests staying in the DPRK enjoyed New Year's concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra at the Mansudae Art Theater on Thursday.
					The performers represented with high artistry the path of shining victory along which the service personnel and people of the DPRK accelerated the onward march for great surge, translating the plan for building a thriving nation into reality under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, and their firm will to bring about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a great, prosperous and powerful country in the new year, too.

articles.title: Women of Cuban Embassy Visit Maternity Hospital
articles.content:
Women of Cuban Embassy Visit Maternity Hospital
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Women of the Cuban embassy here visited the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital Thursday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution. 
					 After being briefed on the fact that the hospital turned into a comprehensive medical service center for women, they went round treatment rooms, sick-wards and other places of the hospital.

articles.title: List of National Football Team Made Public
articles.content:
List of National Football Team Made Public
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Football Association recently made public the list of the national football team for the Asian Cup.
					 The chief coach is Jo Tong Sop, 51. He led the DPRK team to win the 4-nation soccer tournament held in Qatar and the 2010 AFC Challenger Cup.
					
					 Among the 23 players are Hong Yong Jo, Ri Myong Guk, Ji Yun Nam, Ri Jun Il, Pak Nam Chol, Kim Yong Jun, Mun In Guk, Ri Kwang Chon, An Yong Hak and Jong Tae Se who took part in the World Cup last year.
					
					 The Asian Cup will begin in Qatar on January 7. The DPRK team belongs to Group D along with Iran, Iraq and United Arab Emirates.

articles.title: Best Players, Coaches for 2010 Selected
articles.content:
Best Players, Coaches for 2010 Selected
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Ten best players and ten best coaches for Juche 99 (2010) were selected in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The best players are:
					
					1. Kim Un Guk (weightlifter of the April 25 Sports Team)
						2. Jo Yong Chol (shooter of the April 25 National Defense Sports Team)
						3. Yun Kum Ju (boxer of the April 25 Sports Team)
						4. Pak Hyon Suk (weightlifter of the Amnokgang Sports Team)
						5. Pak Myong Won (shooter of the April 25 National Defense Sports Team)
						6. Kim Kum Sok (weightlifter of the Amnokgang Sports Team) 
						7. So Sim Hyang (wrestler of the Amnokgang Sports Team)
						8. Jo Yong Suk (shooter of the Amnokgang National Defense Sports Team)
						9. Pang Kum Chol (weightlifter of the Kigwancha Sports Team)
						10.Cha Kum Chol (weightlifter of the April 25 Sports Team).
					
					 
					
					 The best coaches are:
					
					   1. Pak Ki Song (weightlifting, the April 25 Sports Team)
						   2. Ri Sung Il (shooting, the April 25 National Defense Sports Team)
						3. Ri Kwi Jung (boxing, the April 25 Sports Team)
						   4. Pak Hye Jong (weightlifting, the Amnokgang Sports Team)
						5. Ri Chun Gyong (weightlifting, the Amnokgang Sports Team)
						6. Pak Jong Jin (wrestling, the Amnokgang Sports Team)
						7. Ri Yong Nam (shooting, the Amnokgang National Defense Sports Team)
						8. Ri Chang Gun (weightlifting, the Kigwancha Sports Team)
						9. Ri Yong Hwa (weightlifting, the Pyongyang Sports Team)
						  10.Mun Myong Nam (boxing, the Sports Team under the Ministry of Commerce).

articles.title: Song Full of Confidence in Victory
articles.content:
Song Full of Confidence in Victory
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on January 1 frontpages a song titled "Road to Victory".
					 The song is based on the idea that happiness will surely come after working hard.
					
					 The song has often been included in performances of art troupes like the State Merited Chorus, the Mansudae Art Troupe and the Phibada Opera Troupe, enjoying popularity among the Korean people.
					
					 Reflected in the song is the Korean people's belief that they will emerge victorious under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. The song also represents their strong will to continue going along the road of revolution, pioneered by President Kim Il Sung, under Kim Jong Il's leadership.
					
					 The song encourages the Korean people to turn out in the effort for fulfilling the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial issued by major newspapers of the country.

articles.title: Extra-Large Koryo Celadon
articles.content:
Extra-Large Koryo Celadon
						
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- A celadon flower vase patterned with pine trees and cranes, created by the Mansudae Art Studio in the DPRK, is the largest hard porcelain in the world.
					 It, over two meters high, was inlaid with two pine trees and some ten cranes.
					
					 Azaleas were carved in relief in its upper part and magnolia blossoms inlaid in the lower part in harmony with the main patterns.
					
					 The ground color, jade green, adds to the artistic value of the porcelain.
					
					 The national treasure is on display at the exhibition hall of the Mansudae Art Studio.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improved Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improved Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- It is impossible to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity unless the present inter-Korean relations are turned into the relations of reconciliation and unity, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					 The improved inter-Korean relations are the unanimous aspiration of the compatriots and an urgent demand of the times, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 National reconciliation and unity would be unthinkable without the dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					To actively pursue dialogue and cooperation is one of the important ways to solve the issue of the nation's destiny independently and peacefully by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 It is necessary to create the atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south by placing the interests common to the nation above anything else. 
					
					The purpose of dialogue and cooperation is to remove the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south, promote the national reconciliation and unity and hasten independent reunification.
					
					 Dialogue and cooperation should be oriented to trusting and respecting each other, pushing aside differences and finding common points with sincerity and magnanimity, prompted by the single-minded patriotic desire.
					
					 In order to develop the inter-Korean relations and inject vitality into them in line with the aspiration of the compatriots and the demand of the times it is necessary to actively realize visits, contacts and cooperation not only between authorities but between people from all walks of life in the north, south and abroad.
					
					 When all the political parties and organizations in the north, south and abroad and compatriots from all walks of life make tangible contributions, supporting each other and taking joint actions on the road of reunification and patriotism, national reconciliation and unity and independent reunification will come true earlier.

articles.title: Crackdown on Peace Movement under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Crackdown on Peace Movement under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea released a statement on Dec. 30 last year. It denounced the puppet authorities for cracking down upon the struggle against the building of a naval base on Jeju Island.
					 The statement accused the police of arresting on Dec. 27 dozens of members of civic and social organizations and inhabitants critical of the above-said project and perpetrating violence against the participants in a sit-in strike, wounding several of them.
					
					 It charged that actions were launched against the project because it is a serious factor of not only polluting environment and putting the right to existence at peril but also threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It demanded the authorities immediately halt the project.

articles.title: Military Provocations against DPRK Censured in Britain
articles.content:
Military Provocations against DPRK Censured in Britain
 Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Staffordshire, Britain, Branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a statement on Dec. 20 last year. It lashed out at the south Korean puppet military war-like forces for their military provocations in the waters off Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea and the U.S. for its war moves zealously patronizing them. 
					 The south Korean military perpetrated the provocative shelling, pursuant to one of the many charades orchestrated by the puppet authorities, the statement noted, adding that this is aimed to justify their sinister hostile acts against the DPRK. 
					
					 It blasted the Lee Myung Bak group for pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension in violation of all the points agreed upon between the north and the south and the U.S. for zealously encouraging it in its acts.
					
					 It called on all the anti-imperialist activists and other people who value justice and peace to make efforts to avert a war and defuse tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversaries Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversaries Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Events took place abroad to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 They included meeting, seminar, friendly meeting, Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition in China, Russia, Cuba, Mongolia, Cambodia, Bangladesh, Denmark and Nepal between December 20 and 31 last year.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, books and photos introducing the undying exploits of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu, photos showing the real picture of Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the Korean people's wisdom and skills.
					
					 The attendees of the events included political and social figures and other people of those countries.
					
					 The first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification praised Kim Jong Il as the invincible and iron-willed commander leading the cause of socialism to brilliant victory true to the idea and intention of Kim Il Sung and the leader of the people who has devoted his all to national reunification, the greatest desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers’ Party of Bangladesh said that Kim Jong Il has developed the KPA into an army strong in idea and faith and invincible ranks possessed of modern weapons and equipment.
					
					 The minister of Land Reform and Management of the Nepali government stressed that Kim Jong Suk's exploits would be always remembered not only by the Korean people but by the Nepalese and world progressives.
					
					 Letters and messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Denmark, Nepal and Mongolia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del gobernador de Liaoning
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del gobernador de Liaoning
Pyongyang, 6 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente  Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dedicara el gobernador de la provincia de Liaoning de China, Chen Zhenggao, con motivo del Ano Nuevo.
					  Chen lo entrego el dia 4 al consul general coreano en Shenyang.

articles.title: Publicada propuesta importante de la RPDC para mejorar relaciones N-S
articles.content:
Publicada propuesta importante de la RPDC para mejorar relaciones N-S
						
  Pyongyang, 6 de enero (ATCC) -- El gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea convocaron la reunion conjunta sobre la grave situacion dada en la Peninsula Coreana y las relaciones intercoreanas.
					En esta ocasion debatieron los importantes problemas para superar las dificultades actuales y abrir la nueva fase para la paz y la reunificacion y publicaron el dia 5 una declaracion conjunta.
					
					  A traves de esta nota, partiendo de la decision patriotica de dar inicio a la nueva decada de reunificacion independiente, paz y prosperidad conforme a la voluntad de todos los connacionales, el gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC propusieron a las autoridades, los partidos politicos y las entidades del Sur de Corea los siguientes puntos importantes:
					
					1. Proponemos cortesmente sostener ampliamente el dialogo y las negociaciones con los partidos politicos y entidades del Sur, incluyendo las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					  Con el enfrentamiento no se puede resolver jamas el problema de relaciones intercoreanas ni lograr nada mas que el conflicto armado y guerra. Esto es la conclusion sacada de los 3 anos pasados.
					
					  Para resolver las relaciones intercoreanas en el peor estado, conversaremos y negociaremos activamente con las autoridades, los partidos politicos y las entidades del Sur, sean autoridades o civiles, partido en el poder o el opositor, progresistas o conservadores.
					
					  En particular, insistimos en iniciar pronto e incondicionalmente las conversaciones entre las autoridades que tienen el poder y las responsabilidades.
					
					2. Estamos dispuestos a reunirnos cuandoquiera y dondequiera con los que deseen estrechar la mano con la RPDC sin cuestionar sus antecedentes.
					
					  Para la gran causa de la nacion, vale mas el presente que el pasado e importa mas el futuro que el presente.
					
					  Cuando toda la nacion una sus voces y movilice su inteligencia y fuerzas, se eliminara el peligro de guerra y se adelantara el dia de la paz, la reunificacion y la prosperidad.
					
					3. Discutiremos y resolveremos todos los asuntos importantes de la nacion, incluyendo el aflojamiento de tension, la paz, la reconciliacion, la unidad y la cooperacion, en los dialogos, negociaciones y contactos.
					
					  El Norte y el Sur de Corea deberan tomar una posicion sincera en esos debates relegando los intereses, estrategias y doctrinas fraccionalistas y esforzarse activamente por buscar en todo lo posible los puntos de consenso.
					
					4. Por inmediato, proponemos que ambas partes cesen la difamacion mutua y no incurran en acciones que provoquen a la contraparte, a fin de crear el ambiente a favor del mejoramiento de las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					  En medio de intercambio de difamaciones, calumnias y acciones provocativas, no se puede sostener el dialogo ni las negociaciones ni debatir bien la agenda aunque se sienten a la mesa del dialogo.
					
					  Exhortamos a no cometer desde ahora toda la calumnia y acciones provocativas que profundizan el malentendido y la desconfianza y fomentan la confrontacion y la hostilidad entre el Norte y el Sur.
					
					  Es invariable nuestra posicion de mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas, promover la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion y abrir la fase trascendental de la paz y la reunificacion de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo y las negociaciones.
					
					  El gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC expresan la esperanza de que su propuesta y llamamiento para superar la crisis dada en la Peninsula Coreana y en las relaciones Norte-Sur obtengan la respuesta activa de las autoridades, los partidos politicos y las entidades del Sur de Corea y sean apoyados y respaldados por todos los coreanos dentro y fuera del pais, los gobiernos, los partidos politicos, las entidades de todos los paises del mundo, las organizaciones internacionales y los pueblos progresistas que aman la justicia, la verdad y la paz.

articles.title: Cubanas visitan la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Cubanas visitan la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 6 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 52 aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, las mujeres de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea visitaron el dia 6 la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang.
					Las visitantes recorrieron las salas de tratamiento y de las hospitalizadas y otros lugares escuchando explicaciones de que la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang se ha acondicionado como magnifico centro ginecologico.

articles.title: Publicada lista del equipo coreano de futbol
articles.content:
Publicada lista del equipo coreano de futbol
Pyongyang, 6 de enero (ATCC) -- Hace poco, la Asociacion de Futbol de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico la lista de entrenadores y jugadores de futbol que participaran en la Copa Asiatica 2011.
					  Como entrenador-jefe fue elegido Jo Tong Sop (de 51 anos de edad) quien contribuyo a los buenos resultados de las selecciones coreanas en el torneo de futbol de 4 paises en Qatar y en la Copa de Retadores de la AFC (Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol) de 2010.
					
					  Componen la plantilla 23 jugadores, inclusive los participantes en la Copa Mundial del ano pasado como Hong Yong Jo, Ri Myong Guk, Ji Yun Nam, Ri Jun Il, Pak Nam Chol, Kim Yong Jun, Mun In Guk, Ri Kwang Chon, An Yong Hak y Jong Tae Se.
					
					  En la Copa Asiatica 2011, que iniciara el dia 7 en Qatar, la RPDC jugara frente a Iran, Irak, Emiratos Arabes Unidos en la llave D de las clasificatorias por grupos.

articles.title: Seleccionados 10 jugadores y entrenadores mejores de 2010
articles.content:
Seleccionados 10 jugadores y entrenadores mejores de 2010
  Pyongyang, 6 de enero (ATCC) -- En Corea fueron nominados 10 mejores jugadores y entrenadores para el 99 (2010) de la Era Juche.
					  Los jugadores son Kim Un Guk del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril (levantamiento de pesas), Jo Yong Chol del Conjunto de Deportes Militares 25 de Abril (tiro), Yun Kum Ju del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril (boxeo femenino), Pak Hyon Suk del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang (levantamiento de pesas femenino), Pak Myong Won del Conjunto de Deportes Militares 25 de Abril (tiro), Kim Kum Sok (levantamiento de pesas) y So Sim Hyang (lucha femenina) del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, Jo Yong Suk del Conjunto de Deportes Militares Amnokgang (tiro femenino), Pang Kum Chol del Conjunto Deportivo Kigwancha (levantamiento de pesas) y Cha Kum Chol del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril (levantamiento de pesas). 
					
					Los 10 mejores directores tecnicos son Pak Ki Song (levantamiento de pesas) del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, Ri Sung Il (tiro) del Conjunto de Deportes Militares 25 de Abril, Ri Kwi Jung (boxeo) del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, Pak Hye Jong (f) y Ri Chun Gyong (levantamiento de pesas) y Pak Jong Jin (lucha) del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, Ri Yong Nam (tiro) del Conjunto de Deportes Militares Amnokgang, Ri Chang Gun (levantamiento de pesas) del Conjunto Deportivo Kigwancha, Ri Yong Hwa (levantamiento de pesas femenino) del Conjunto Deportivo de Pyongyang y Mun Myong Nam (boxeo) del Conjunto Deportivo del Ministerio de Comercio.
